servinfo.title: Intake Collector and Intake Manifold Removal and Installation

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Intake Collector and Intake Manifold Components

s1.ptxt: Remove electric throttle body assembly referring to Electric Throttle Body Assembly Removal and Installation .
Disconnect water hose (1) from heater outlet pipe.
Disconnect MAP sensor connector (if equipped) (1) and fuel injector harness connector (2).
Remove harness clamp bracket (right side) (3) from intake collector.
Disconnect vacuum hose (4) of EVAP canister purge valve from intake collector.
Disconnect EVAP canister purge valve connector (1) and ground terminals (2).
Remove harness clamp bracket (left side) (3) from intake collector.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect connector from EGR valve assembly (1).
Disconnect EGR pipe (2) and PCV hose (3).

s1.ptxt: Detach intake collector (4) from intake manifold, and then disconnect water hose (5).
Remove EGR valve assembly (1) (if equipped) and PCV pipe (2) from intake collector, if necessary.
Disconnect brake booster hose (2) and vacuum tank hose (4) from intake manifold (1) then EVAP canister purge valve hose (3) from fuel No.2 pipe (5).
Disconnect fuel feed hose (1) and fuel return hose (2).
Remove intake manifold bolts (8 pcs.) and nuts (4 pcs.).

servinfosub.title: Installation
servinfosub.ptxt: Reverse removal procedure for installation noting the following.

item.ptxt: Use new intake collector gaskets, and EGR pipe gasket (if equipped).
Install electric throttle body assembly referring to Electric Throttle Body Assembly Removal and Installation .
Check to ensure that all removed parts are back in place.
Reinstall any necessary parts which have not been reinstalled.
Refill cooling system referring to Cooling System Flush and Refill .
Upon completion of installation, verify that there is no fuel leakage at each connection according to Fuel Leakage Check Procedure .
If EGR valve is removed, use new EGR valve gasket. (with EGR system)
If EGR plate is removed, use new EGR plate gasket. (without EGR system)
